content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can implement the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width = 10)
    str = ""
    for word in words
        if length(str) + length(word) > text_width
            println(str)
            str = word
        elseif isempty(str)
            str = word
        else
            str *= " $(word)"
        end
    end
    println(str)  # print the last line of string
end
```

Let's say we have a list `["one", "two", "three", "four", "five"]`, and we want to wrap the words with `text_width` equals to `5`.

```julia
words = ["one", "two", "three", "four", "five"]
wrap_string(words, 5)
```
This will output:
```
one two
three four five
```
